page.title: 08COMING TO PETERLEE
page.content: I came to Peterlee five years ago because my Dad works for N.S.K. and he was told to work in the Peterlee Factory.As soon as I got out of the aeroplane I needed my overcoat because it is much cooler in England than in Japan.The weather here is terrible but their are no dreadful storms.In Winter it is much cooler outside but not in the house because of central heating. One thing I like most about living here is that there are no earthquakes. There are at least four a week in Japan,that is why the houses are made of wood and not bricks. The way people dress is a bit different too.Adults dress more or less the same but the children wear shorts everyday in Japan except the older ones who wear uniforms.
